  • Method Details

    • marshal

      public static String marshal(Object jaxbBean)
      Marshals the given JAXB bean into an XML string. Marshaller.marshal(Object, java.io.Writer) is called.
      Parameters:
      jaxbBean - The JAXB bean to be marshaled.
      Returns:
      The XML string representation of the JAXB bean.
      See Also:
      • JAXBContext.newInstance(Class...)
      • Marshaller.marshal(Object, java.io.OutputStream)

    • unmarshal

      public static <T> T unmarshal(Class<? extends T> cls, String xml)
      Unmarshals the given XML string into an object of the specified class.
      invalid reference 
      Unmarshaller#unmarshal(Object, java.io.Writer)
      is called.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the object to be returned.
      Parameters:
      cls - The class of the object to be returned.
      xml - The XML string to be unmarshaled.
      Returns:
      The unmarshaled object of the specified class.
      See Also:
      • JAXBContext.newInstance(Class...)
      • invalid reference 
        Unmarshaller#unmarshal(Object, java.io.Reader)

    • createDOMParser

      public static DocumentBuilder createDOMParser(boolean ignoreComments, boolean ignoringElementContentWhitespace)
      Creates a new instance of DocumentBuilder with the specified configuration.
      Parameters:
      ignoreComments - Whether to ignore comments in the XML.
      ignoringElementContentWhitespace - Whether to ignore whitespace in element content.
      Returns:
      A new instance of DocumentBuilder with the specified configuration.
      See Also:
      • DocumentBuilderFactory.newDocumentBuilder()

    • createContentParser

      public static DocumentBuilder createContentParser()
      Creates a new instance of DocumentBuilder for parsing content. Call recycleContentParser to reuse the instance.
      Returns:
      A new instance of DocumentBuilder.

    • recycleContentParser

      public static void recycleContentParser(DocumentBuilder docBuilder)
      Recycles the given DocumentBuilder instance by resetting it and adding it back to the pool.
      Parameters:
      docBuilder - The DocumentBuilder instance to be recycled.

      public static void transform(Document source, File output)
      Transforms the given XML Document to the specified output file.
      Parameters:

      output - The output file where the transformed XML will be written.
      Throws:
      UncheckedIOException - if an IOException occurs during file operations.
      See Also:
      • Transformer.transform(Source, Result)

    • getElementsByTagName

      public static List<Element> getElementsByTagName(Element node, String tagName)
      Gets the elements by tag name.
      Parameters:
      node - The parent element to search within.
      tagName - The tag name of the elements to find.
      Returns:
      A list of elements with the specified tag name that are direct children of the given node.

    • getNodesByName

      public static List<Node> getNodesByName(Node node, String nodeName)
      Gets the nodes by name.
      Parameters:
      node - The parent node to search within.
      nodeName - The name of the nodes to find.
      Returns:
      A list of nodes with the specified name.

    • getNextNodeByName

      public static Node getNextNodeByName(Node node, String nodeName)
      Gets the next node by name.
      Parameters:
      node - The parent node to search within.
      nodeName - The name of the node to find.
      Returns:
      The next node with the specified name, or null if no such node is found.

    • getAttribute

      @MayReturnNull public static String getAttribute(Node node, String attrName)
      Gets the attribute value of the specified attribute name from the given XML node.
      Parameters:
      node - The XML node from which to get the attribute.
      attrName - The name of the attribute to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The value of the specified attribute, or null if the attribute does not exist.

    • readAttributes

      public static Map<String,String> readAttributes(Node node)
      Reads the attributes of the given XML node and returns them as a map.
      Parameters:
      node - The XML node from which to read the attributes.
      Returns:
      A map containing the attributes of the given node, where the keys are attribute names and the values are attribute values.

    • readElement

      public static Map<String,String> readElement(Element element)
      Reads the given XML element and returns its attributes and text content as a map.
      Parameters:
      element - The XML element to be read.
      Returns:
      A map containing the attributes and text content of the given element, where the keys are attribute names and the values are attribute values.

    • isTextElement

      public static boolean isTextElement(Node node)
      Checks if the given node is a text element. A text element is defined as an element that does not contain any child elements.
      Parameters:
      node - The node to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if the node is a text element, false otherwise.

    • getTextContent

      public static String getTextContent(Node node)
      Gets the text content of the given XML node.
      Parameters:
      node - The XML node from which to get the text content.
      Returns:
      The text content of the specified node, with leading and trailing whitespace removed.

    • getTextContent

      public static String getTextContent(Node node, boolean ignoreWhiteChar)
      Gets the text content of the given XML node, optionally ignoring whitespace characters.
      Parameters:
      node - The XML node from which to get the text content.
      ignoreWhiteChar - Whether to ignore whitespace characters in the text content. if true, all the whitespace within text content will be removed.
      Returns:
      The text content of the specified node, with all the whitespace within text content will be removed if ignoreWhiteChar is true.

    • writeCharacters

      public static void writeCharacters(char[] cbuf, StringBuilder output) throws IOException
      Writes the characters from the specified character array to the given StringBuilder.
      Parameters:
      cbuf - The character array containing the characters to be written.
      output - The StringBuilder to which the characters will be written.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • writeCharacters

      public static void writeCharacters(char[] cbuf, int off, int len, StringBuilder output) throws IOException
      Writes a portion of a character array to the given StringBuilder.
      Parameters:
      cbuf - The character array containing the characters to be written.
      off - The start offset in the character array.
      len - The number of characters to write.
      output - The StringBuilder to which the characters will be written.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
